title: Dublin’s Housing First programme is on pause, raising questions about competitive tendering for social care services
content: “Housing First works best when it is high quality, consistent and for as long as necessary,” says Samara Jones, coordinator of the Housing First Europe Hub.

title: After years of work by council, government abruptly spiked policy meant to deliver arts spaces in the city
content: “It was hugely dispiriting,” says Labour Councillor Darragh Moriarty, who chairs Dublin City Council’s arts committee.

title: ‘Very difficult’ travel conditions and some homes without power after torrential rain
content: Met Éireann is warning of very heavy rain, thunder and widespread flooding in several counties on Monday.

title: My money: ‘I got my car on a PCP – so basically I’m renting a rapidly depreciating couch that moves’
content: Bernard O’Shea is a comedian, writer, and broadcaster.

title: After 20 years of neglect, a notorious Dublin building can finally be brought back to life
content: Dublin council becomes legal owner of former Neary’s pub and hotel on Parnell Street after dispute resolved

title: ‘Woo, the tenants are going today’: Landlord who allegedly banged bowl with spoon ordered to pay €8,000
content: RTB tribunal found notices of termination for of anti-social behaviour were invalid

title: Govt to sign off on €100bn new National Development Plan
content: Coalition leaders and senior ministers will meet to sign off on the €100bn revised National Development Plan.

title: Government planning for €200bn investment in capital expenditure over next decade
content: Minister Jack Chambers said that the money will give a “transformational opportunity” to the Irish economy.
